summary: This is an email from August 16, 2019, detailing the Bureau of Prisons' staffing plan to provide Temporary Duty (TDY) assistance and operational review teams at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York following Jeffrey Epstein's death. It outlines specific positions and numbers of staff being deployed to stabilize the facility.

persons.name: Ray
persons.context: Addressed in the email chain; credited with work to stabilize the MCC and asked to provide personnel information.

events.title: Correctional Services Administrator Return to MCC NYM
events.description: A Correctional Services Administrator from the Northeast Regional Office is scheduled to return to MCC New York to provide expertise in inmate accountability and Special Housing Unit operations.

events.title: Evaluation Visit to MCC NYM
events.description: The email author plans to return to MCC New York to evaluate the progress of the stabilization efforts and thank the initial TDY staff.

keyFacts: The Bureau of Prisons initiated a significant staffing surge at MCC New York in August 2019, deploying up to 35 temporary staff including a warden, deputy warden, lieutenants, and correctional officers.
The deployment was part of a stabilization effort following a major incident, implicitly the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019.
Specialized national review teams were being formed to audit and reform procedures in Correctional Services and Correctional Programs at the facility.
The email indicates high-level oversight and concern regarding operations at MCC New York in the immediate aftermath of Epstein's death.
